intro: Gyrotaenia crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf gyrotaenia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its robust, sprawling growth habit and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in green or red bracts. Gyrotaenia crassifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
